Plot

Source: R/plot.R
Plot.Rd

The R6 class Plot generates plots from on History data. It is usually actually invoked by calling the generic plot(h), where h is an History class instance.

Usage

Plot <- Plot$new()

Methods

cumulative(history,...)

Writes a plot of cumulative regret or reward (depending on parameter regret=TRUE/FALSE) over time.

average(history,...)

Writes a plot of average regret or reward (depending on parameter regret=TRUE/FALSE) over time.

arms(history),...

Writes a plot of the ratio with which each arm of a simulation was chosen over time. If multiple agents are run, only plots the arm plot of the first agent.

Plot method arguments

regret

(logical, TRUE) If regret is TRUE, regret will be plotted on the y-axis. When regret is set to FALSE, reward will be plotted on the y-axis.

rate

(logical, TRUE) If rate is TRUE, the rate of the regret or reward is plotted.

limit_agents

(list , NULL) Limit the plotted agents to the agents in list.

no_par

(logical, FALSE) If no_par is TRUE, Plot() does not set or adjust plotting parameters. This makes it possible to set your own plotting parameters, for instance, when position multiple Plots in a no_par.

legend

(logical, TRUE) Print the legend.

legend_title

(character , NULL) Set a legend title.

legend_labels

(list , NULL) Set legend labels to custom values as specificed in this list.

legend_border

(logical , NULL) Set a legend title.

xlim

(c(integer,integer), NULL) Set x-axis limits.

ylim

(c(integer,integer), NULL) Set y-axis limits.

use_colors

(logical, TRUE) If use_colors is set to FALSE, plots will be in grayscale. Otherwise, plots will make use of a color palette.

ci

(logical, FALSE) When ci is TRUE, Plot() will display 95

traces

(logical , FALSE) When traces is TRUE, Plot() will plot the traces of each independent simulation.

traces_max

(integer , 100) The maximum number of trace lines.

traces_alpha

(numeric , 0.3) Sets the opacity of all trace lines. By default traces_alpha is set to 0.3, that is, at an opacity of 30

smooth

(logical , FALSE) When smooth is TRUE, Plot() will smooth all plots.

interval

(integer, NULL) Plot only for every every t

color_step

(integer, 1) Linecharts will cycle through agents/color_step colors.

color_step

(integer, 1) Linecharts will cycle through agents/lty_step line types

lwd

(integer, 1) Linecharts will be of lwd width.

See also

Core contextual classes: Bandit, Policy, Simulator, Agent, History, Plot

Bandit subclass examples: BasicBernoulliBandit, ContextualLogitBandit, OfflinePolicyEvaluatorBandit

Policy subclass examples: EpsilonGreedyPolicy, ContextualThompsonSamplingPolicy
